page.title: 06SUMMERCOURT SCHOOL
page.content: Children have been taught in the village school for about 100 years. It is a small building on the edge of the village,built when different conditions applied,right by the side of the A:30 trunk road.Heavy vehicles now roar past and the window facing the road has been protected.The pavement outside the school is edged by strong metal railings and the movement of pupils is carefully controlled by teachers and a lollipop lady.The wall top is also wired to prevent children climbing over to retrieve lost balls. There are about 80 children under the age of 11 at the school with 4 teachers,1 caretaker,1 secretary and 3 cooks.For their Secondary Education they transfer to Newquay Treviglas School.This means a journey from the village of about 6 miles each day.
